str2: Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.
Two. A primary numeral; 'two'.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To agree with, harmonize with, agree together. From sumphonos; to be harmonious, i.e. to accord or stipulate.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
